tweet: I signed an executive order today banning any State of Idaho governmental entity from requiring so-called “vaccine passports” – or proof of COVID-19 vaccination for citizens to receive public services or access facilities.  https://t.co/394lHwC5q4

tweet: Starting March 29, any Idahoan with at least one medical condition will be able to access the COVID-19 vaccine.

name: Brad Little
tweet: 40% of Idaho’s 65+ population have now received at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. Great job, Idaho. Keep up the good work! #IdahoCOVID19

tweet: Please be patient in getting an appointment to receive your COVID-19 vaccine. Our supply is extremely limited compared to demand. Idaho is working constantly to secure more of the safe and effective COVID-19 vaccine.

name: Brad Little
tweet: Though the vaccine an outstanding step forward in the fight against the COVID-19 virus, we must remain vigilant in our defense. We must continue to wear masks, avoid gatherings, and keep safe physical distance to protect lives as we await widespread distribution of the vaccine.

name: Brad Little
tweet: We recognize there is a great demand for this life-saving tool, and we expect changes and evolution when it comes to managing supply. The COVID-19 vaccine continues to arrive in Idaho, and I urge Idahoans to be patient with the distribution.

name: Brad Little
tweet: Thank a health care worker and choose to combat COVID-19 by following safety protocols.   https://t.co/YCSX5I9xpV

tweet: As individuals, we must choose to do all we can to combat COVID-19 in order to relieve pressure on Idaho’s health care workers. We can show our gratitude by minimizing transmissible moments this holiday season.   https://t.co/PlcAjXGEOS

tweet: Teresa and I are sending prayers to the President and First Lady for a speedy recovery from COVID-19. The pandemic is not over, and we must remain vigilant in defense of the virus. Wash your hands. Wear a mask. Together we will get through these unprecedented times.
